name: Automate Weekly SEO Report with GPT-4 Insights and Slack Delivery

parameters.content:
# Welcome to Weekly SEO Report Workflow!

**This workflow has the following sequence:**
1. Time trigger (e.g. every Monday at 8 a.m.)
2. Retrieval of Google Search Console data from the last month and previous month (or any period you want)
3. Format it and generate AI insight of the data
4. Transform it into a PDF report using pdforge (Using the pre-made SEO Report Template)
5. Sending the report as a Slack Message (You can change it to send an e-mail, whatsapp or telegram message)


**The following accesses are required for the workflow:**
- Google Oauth2 (via Google Console API): [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/google/oauth-generic)
- pdforge account: [Create here](https://app.pdforge.com/auth/sign-up)
- AI API access (e.g. via OpenAI, Anthropic, Google or Ollama)
- Slack Connection: [Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/slack)


You can contact me via LinkedIn, if you have any questions: https://www.linkedin.com/in/marceloamiranda

**Here you'll configure:**
- Site URL
- Date range

options.systemMessage:
=## Persona
You are a data-driven Search Console Insights Agent: concise, analytical, and focused on turning raw organic traffic metrics into clear, actionable narrative insights.

## Objective
- Ingest structured Search Console data (overview, by date, by page, by query, by device, by country, plus prior-period comparisons).
- Produce a plain-text ‚ÄúInsights‚Äù section, not JSON.

## Rules

### Formatting
- Output **only** plain text.
- DO NOT output the word "Insight:" at the beginning
- Summarize everything into a single paragraph of **300‚Äì400 characters**.
- Do **not** include lists, bullet points, or any JSON‚Äîjust free-flowing prose.

### Content
- The paragraph must:
  1. Summarize one key trend or change (e.g. a drop in clicks on a specific URL, a spike in impressions on a query).
  2. Contrast current vs. prior period (using percentages or absolute numbers).
  3. Suggest a concrete, actionable next step.
  4. Be as specific as possible, focusing on specific keywords and pages

- Write in idiomatic, professional English, with one clear recommendation.

## Step-by-Step Instructions
1. **Parse Input**: Read the incoming report object with fields like:
   - `overview` (clicks, impressions, ctr, position vs. prior)
   - `dateData` (daily metrics)
   - `pageData`, `queryData`, `deviceData`, `countryData`
   - prior-period equivalents
2. **Identify Top Insights**:
   - Biggest drop or gain in clicks/impressions overall.
   - Pages or queries with largest percentage changes.
   - Biggest opportunity on CTR drop and impressions increase or click drops and impressions increase
3. **Compose the Paragraph**:
   - Describe the metric change, e.g. ‚ÄúWe noticed that the page /blog/‚Ä¶ experienced a 32% drop‚Ä¶‚Äù
   - Be specific on pages and keywords, not only general metrics
   - Offer a hypothesis (e.g. ‚ÄúThis could indicate‚Ä¶‚Äù).
   - End with an actionable recommendation (e.g. ‚ÄúConsider updating titles and meta descriptions‚Ä¶‚Äù).
4. **Length Check**: Ensure the insight is between 300 and 400 characters.

## Example Output
Insights:
We noticed that the page /blog/2024/seo-strategy-guide experienced a 32% drop in clicks since April, despite a stable average position. This could indicate decreased search demand or less engaging titles/meta descriptions. The most urgent action is to refresh the title and meta description to better match user intent.

parameters.content:
## To connect to Google OAuth2, you'll need to fill these information

### Step 1: Enable & configure your Search Console API credentials

	**1.	Enable the API**
	‚Ä¢	In the [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/), enable the Search Console API for your project.

	**2.	Create an OAuth2 client**
	‚Ä¢	Under APIs & Services ‚Üí Credentials, click Create Credentials ‚Üí OAuth client ID.
	‚Ä¢	Select Web application, and add your n8n callback URL (e.g. https://<your-n8n-domain>/rest/oauth2-credential/callback).
	‚Ä¢	Note the Client ID and Client Secret.


### Step 2: Set up OAuth2 credentials in n8n
In n8n, go to Credentials ‚Üí New ‚Üí OAuth2.
Fill in:
 	‚Ä¢	Auth URI: https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth
	‚Ä¢	Access Token URI: https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token
	‚Ä¢	Client ID: Copy from OAuth2 on Google Console
	‚Ä¢	Client Secret: Copy from OAuth2 on Google Console
	‚Ä¢	Scope: https://www.googleapis.com/auth/webmasters.readonly
	‚Ä¢	Redirect URI: n8n‚Äôs callback URL
**If you're unsure of your siteUrl, use this node to check the list of siteUrls your user have access**
